solution_line_template: A pencil last {pencil_lifespan_hours} hours because {sharpenings_per_pencil} x {hours_per_sharpening} = <<{sharpenings_per_pencil}*{hours_per_sharpening}={pencil_lifespan_hours}>>{pencil_lifespan_hours}

The pencils she has will last {total_initial_pencil_lifespan} hours because {initial_pencils} x {pencil_lifespan_hours} = <<{initial_pencils}*{pencil_lifespan_hours}={total_initial_pencil_lifespan}>>{total_initial_pencil_lifespan}

She needs {additional_hours_needed} more hours of writing because {total_hours_needed} - {total_initial_pencil_lifespan} = <<{total_hours_needed}-{total_initial_pencil_lifespan}={additional_hours_needed}>>{additional_hours_needed}

She will need {additional_pencils_needed} more pencils to reach this because {additional_hours_needed} / {pencil_lifespan_hours} = <<{additional_hours_needed}/{pencil_lifespan_hours}={additional_pencils_needed}>>{additional_pencils_needed}

She will spend ${total_cost_additional_pencils} on pencils because {additional_pencils_needed} x {cost_per_new_pencil} = <<{additional_pencils_needed}*{cost_per_new_pencil}={total_cost_additional_pencils}>>{total_cost_additional_pencils}
